intro: Daucus kotovii, commonly known as the Siberian carrot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many familiar vegetables and herbs such as carrots and parsley. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other carrot relatives. Daucus kotovii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or alpine environments.
